page.title: 07St. Mewan Parish Church
page.content: St. Mewan Church is situated just over a mile from St. Austell and just a few miles from the coast. The Church dates back to Norman times. The foundations of the bell tower and the base of the font were built in 1100. The stained glass windows are Victorian and each one shows an incident in Jesus' life. There are many societies and clubs associated with the Church including: Youth Club, Girl Guides, Women's Institute, Creche & The Sunday School. Many local people are also connected with the Church through bell ringing and by singing in the choir. In the past 25 years, four vicars have lived and worked in St. Mewan. In 1982 a new vicarage was built just across the road from the church. Each Sunday 60 people from the local community attend the services at St. Mewan Church. (Avis Martin)
